translation.en: [woman] Once a mostly harmless, leafy pick-me-up
for the indigenous people of South America,
the modern story of cocaine goes like so:
translation.ko: 코카인의 현대 역사는 다음과 같이 정의됩니다

translation.en: Freud, Pablo Escobar,
disco hedonism, Wall Street hedonism,
crack, El Chapo,
more Wall Street hedonism.
Cocaine has been a target of law enforcement
around the world for years,
but it remains one of the most profitable businesses
translation.ko: 아직도 국제 범죄 조직엔 21세기의 가장 수익성 있는

translation.en: of the 21st century.
So, what makes the cocaine business so bulletproof?
I grew up all over the world
because my dad was an economist who focused on developing economies.
translation.ko: "아마릴리스 폭스 전 CIA 분석가" 아버지가 개발도상국 전문 경제학자였기 때문이죠

translation.en: And then I wound up doing my undergrad at Oxford University,
translation.ko: 그리고 저도 옥스퍼드 대학교에 진학해 학부에서

translation.en: focused on international law.
It was my last year there that 9/11 happened,
translation.ko: 대학교 졸업반 때 일어난 911 테러 사건은

translation.en: and it completely shattered my universe.
I wanted to understand what caused it and how it could have happened.
translation.ko: 원인이 뭔지, 어떻게 그런 일이 일어났는지 알고 싶었어요

translation.en: So, I set about writing an algorithm that took historical data
translation.ko: 그래서 과거의 데이터를 연구해서 다음 공격을

translation.en: and processed it to predict the next attack.
translation.ko: 예측할 수 있는 알고리듬을 쓰기 시작했고

translation.en: And it got the attention of the CIA.
And I worked with them for almost a decade as a field operative,
translation.ko: 거의 10년 동안 CIA에서 현장 요원으로 일하며

translation.en: keeping WMD out of the hands of non-state actors,
translation.ko: 대량 살상 무기가 알카에다와 그 외 다른 테러 조직과

translation.en: terror groups like al-Qaeda and their affiliates around the world.
translation.ko: 비국가 활동 세력의 손에 들어가는 걸 막는 일을 했죠

translation.en: We're 18 years into the war on terrorism,
and sometimes that can feel like the longest American war.
translation.ko: 이게 미국이 개입한 가장 긴 전쟁이라 느껴지는데

translation.en: But there's this other one that's lasted even longer, decades longer,
translation.ko: 그보다 더 오래 수십 년 동안 계속되는 전쟁이

translation.en: the war on drugs.
And just like the war on terrorism, it's cost millions of dollars
and thousands of lives.
And the only way we're gonna understand how to bring it to an end
translation.ko: 마약과의 전쟁을 끝내는 방법을 이해하는 유일한 법은

translation.en: is to understand the economics that drive it.
[Roy] People out there are doing it bigger than I am, but, hey, good for them.
translation.ko: 나보다 더 큰 규모로 하는 사람들도 있지만 까짓 그러라고 해요

translation.en: As long as I got it and it's good, I'm always gonna have customers.
translation.ko: 좋은 물건만 있으면 고객은 항상 있으니까요

translation.en: This is what I'm doing, and this works for me.
translation.ko: 이게 내 일이고 내 적성에 잘 맞아요

translation.en: So, did you grow up around here, in Los Angeles?
Yeah, I'm from Compton, yeah.
Do you remember, as a kid, being around cocaine or dealing at all?
translation.ko: 혹시 어렸을 때 코카인 거래하는 거 본 기억이 있나요?

translation.en: Yeah, I seen how good it was when my pops was doing it.
translation.ko: 그럼요, 아버지가 하실 때 정말 좋았거든요

translation.en: We had everything we wanted for Christmas. So it was like,
translation.ko: 크리스마스 때 원하는 선물은 다 받았어요

translation.en: "Hey, if I could do that when I have kids, I'm gonna do the same thing."
translation.ko: 나도 나중에 애 낳으면 똑같이 해주고 싶었고요

translation.en: There wasn't anything else that was gonna make that much?
translation.ko: 그만한 돈을 벌 만한 다른 일은 없었어요?

translation.en: Where I came from?
Nah, you could try to make a dollar, get a job.
translation.ko: 아뇨, 남들처럼 직장을 다닐 수도 있지만

translation.en: I make the same amount that they make in, what, a whole day?
translation.ko: 그 사람들이 종일 일해야 버는 돈을

translation.en: I make it-- I can make it in 30 seconds.
How do the economics of it work for you?
translation.ko: 그럼 거래는 주로 어떤 식으로 하죠?

translation.en: What I'm dealing with, I'm only dealing with about four,
translation.ko: 난 한 번 거래할 때 100g 정도만 하고

translation.en: you know what I'm saying, to five ounces at a time.
An ounce is already like $900.
How much more are you making when you sell?
I'm probably doubling or tripling.
translation.ko: 두 배나 세 배 정도를 받는데

translation.en: -Wow. -Depends on who I'm selling to.
-So, how does the structure work? -So, it's like a pyramid, you know?
translation.ko: 구조는 어떤 식인가요? 꼭 피라미드 같아요

translation.en: One big boss who comes down to another, then there's us.
translation.ko: 맨 위 보스 밑에 누가 있고 그 밑에 우리가 있어요

translation.en: It's like that company, Avon. Remember, "Avon calling"?
translation.ko: 에이번이란 회사와 비슷하네요 그 회사 기억해요?

translation.en: -Yeah, they used to go to the doors, yeah. -Yeah.
The Avon lady used to buy from my dad.
translation.ko: 에이번 여사 한 분이 아빠 고객이었어요

translation.en: -No way. -Yeah.
So, it was like, I knew what Avon was.
-[laughs] -Yeah, I knew exactly what it was.
[Fox] Dealing $20 bags
is enough for Roy to provide for his family
without running the risk of serious jail time.
Anyone caught with more than a kilo
can expect up to 25 years in prison.
My dad, he did get caught.
-What happened when he got caught? -They came to kick the door in.
translation.ko: 잡혔을 때 상황이 어땠어요? 누가 막 문을 두드렸어요

translation.en: And I was about ten when that happened.
My pops, he was doing, like, major, major stuff.
'Cause I didn't want to see what my pops went through, that's a lesson.
translation.ko: 아버지가 겪은 일 겪기 싫어요 교훈을 얻은 거죠

translation.en: I only deal with a few ounces at a time, so that's just to keep me under the radar.
translation.ko: 크게 이목을 안 끌려고 한 번에 몇십 그램씩만 팔아요

translation.en: So, my economics of it, it keeps me home and safe.
translation.ko: 내 계산으로는 그래야 나와 가족이 안전해요

translation.en: My money stays consistent
because these people that I sell to, they can't stop it.
When you ingest cocaine, it tricks the brain into thinking
translation.ko: 코카인을 하게 되면 코카인이 뭔가 보람 있는 일을 한다고 뇌를 속여요

translation.en: you've had something incredibly, incredibly rewarding.
translation.ko: 코카인이 뭔가 보람 있는 일을 한다고 뇌를 속여요

translation.en: There's this intense energy.
It enhances the heart rate.
Temperature goes up, your pupils dilate.
And at the top, the glee, the joy.
It enhances the levels of dopamine in the brain very rapidly,
and that's what makes it very addictive, because you have to keep taking it
translation.ko: 그래서 중독되는 거예요 그때 느낀 쾌락을 경험하려고

translation.en: to try to get back that high.
But you can never get it back because the brain has changed.
translation.ko: 문제는 뇌는 이미 변해서 그 쾌락을 경험할 수 없어요

translation.en: It can never get back to that original dopamine rush.
translation.ko: 처음 느낀 그 도파민의 흥분을 못 느끼게 돼요

translation.en: [Fox] In 2017, almost 2,000 tons of pure cocaine were produced,
a 25 percent increase from 2016.
And that production is feeding consumption
by an estimated 18.1 million global users.
The number of new users in the US has nearly doubled since 2013.
translation.ko: 미국의 새 사용자는 2013년 이후 거의 두 배가 됐습니다

translation.en: And normally, a surge in demand would mean a surge in price,
but that hasn't happened with cocaine.
The price of cocaine in the US
has stayed incredibly stable for a long time.
The price of almost nothing else has.
This is not a market where people compete necessarily on price.
translation.ko: 가격을 놓고 사람들이 경쟁하는 시장이 아니니까요 "로드리고 카날레스 부교수 예일 경영대 조직 행동 연구"

translation.en: Rather, people compete on the reliability with which they can serve the market.
translation.ko: 오히려 사람들은 시장에 꾸준히 제공할 수 있다는 신뢰로 경쟁하죠

translation.en: So, let's start with the consumers.
The way consumers choose their dealer
is somebody who can reliably give them their drugs
translation.ko: 꾸준히 약을 댈 수 있다는 믿음을 주고

translation.en: and who's not gonna be changing price a lot.
translation.ko: 가격을 자주 안 바꾸는 사람을 골라요

translation.en: The price of each gram of cocaine has stayed at around $100
for over 25 years.
An analogy would be in the video game industry,
where the prices of video games have stayed constant around $60 per game
translation.ko: 비디오 게임 가격도 아주 오랫동안 게임당

translation.en: for a very long time.
And it's certainly not because technology has not evolved.
translation.ko: 기술이 발전하지 않아서 그런 건 절대 아니에요

translation.en: It's because the price of $60 per game
gives you a very effective coordination mechanism
for how much they should expect to pay for the next video game.
translation.ko: 얼마를 낼지 예상할 수 있는 효율적인 조정 기제가 됩니다

translation.en: When we translate it to a market like cocaine,
that's good practice,
both for consumers, but also for the organizations themselves,
because it's so dependent on reliability.
Any successful industry requires stable supply and demand.
translation.ko: 성공적인 사업에는 안정적 수요와 공급이 필수인데

translation.en: And with an abundance of unoccupied land
and the ideal growing climate for coca,
Colombia is the largest producer of cocaine in the world.
It's been that way since the '80s,
when the American DEA and the local governments
translation.ko: 지방 정부에서 볼리비아와 페루의 코카인 거래를

translation.en: shut down the coke trade in Bolivia and Peru.
In Colombia, the coke business thrived
under the legendary cartel head Pablo Escobar,
translation.ko: 전설적인 카르텔 두목인 파블로 에스코바르 때였어요

translation.en: who, at the height of his power, was making $420 million a week,
largely because his operation was completely vertically integrated.
translation.ko: 파블로의 조직이 수직 통합형이라 가능한 일이었죠

translation.en: So, there is a parallel to be drawn between a normal company
-and the Pablo Escobar world, right? -Right.
IKEA is a very clear example of that.
As a seller of furniture,
IKEA owns their own forests in several parts of the world,
translation.ko: 이케아는 세계 여러 곳에 숲을 소유하고 있어

translation.en: so that they can manage the supply of wood
in a more reliable way than purchasing wood from the open market.
And they have their own milling operations,
and they have their own designers.
That's what we saw Pablo Escobar do.
He was absorbing the profits
from every single aspect of the value chain.
He just took over producers, coca growers,
the labs, the processors,
then transportation and wholesale of cocaine
to then, actually, last-mile distribution,
which is partly what made him so vulnerable.
Integration can make sense from a profit perspective,
translation.ko: 통합 관리는 이익을 내는 데는 유리하지만

translation.en: but because this is a black market,
it's a very high risk that you're taking.
[Fox] Being cocaine's one-stop shop
made Escobar a huge target for the DEA and the Colombian government,
translation.ko: 에스코바르 조직은 마약단속국과 콜롬비아 정부의 표적이 됐고

translation.en: and when the Medellín Cartel collapsed,
that vertically integrated model toppled along with it.
translation.ko: 그와 함께 수직 통합 모델도 무너졌습니다

translation.en: That was a cataclysmic event that decentralized
translation.ko: 이것은 엄청난 사건으로 콜롬비아 마약 거래를

translation.en: and completely restructured the Colombian drug trade.
[in Spanish] The national police managed to dismantle these large cartels.
translation.ko: 경찰은 이 큰 카르텔들을 해체할 수 있었고 "에르난도 플로레스 여단장 콜롬비아 육군"

translation.en: There is not one big cartel that owns everything.
translation.ko: 모든 걸 독점한 하나의 거대 카르텔은 없어요

translation.en: But... this brought us another issue,
the hydra phenomenon.
When you cut off the head...
several smaller heads appear.
We see the drug business has become more complex...
in terms of tracking those who are linked at each stage of the process.
translation.ko: 각 판매 단계에서 연결된 자들을 추적하는 게 어려워졌어요

translation.en: [Fox in English] Buenaventura is Colombia's largest port.
It sends shipments to 300 cities worldwide
and handles 60 percent of Colombia's imports and exports.
Everything from consumer goods, like coffee and bananas, to drugs.
translation.ko: 물건은 커피나 바나나 같은 소비재에서 마약까지 다양합니다

translation.en: Buenaventura is located between the sea, the Pacific Ocean,
uh, which leads to Argentina,
up to Panama, Mexico, USA, and Asia.
So, this is the exit for all cocaine that's gonna go out
translation.ko: 여기가 콜롬비아에서 태평양 항로를 통해 해외로 나가는

translation.en: -the Pacific route from Colombia? -[Herrera] Yeah, exactly.
[Fox] The port generates $1.8 billion a year in customs tax revenue.
translation.ko: 항구는 관세 수입으로 매년 18억 달러를 벌지만

translation.en: But the city and the surrounding regions see little of it.
translation.ko: 도시와 주변 지역은 그 혜택을 거의 받지 못합니다

translation.en: [Fox] I mean, I've traveled all over the world,
and it's rare to see
this level of poverty sustained street after street after street.
translation.ko: 이렇게 가난한 나라는 정말 보기 힘들어요

translation.en: Such inequality.
Is that what drives the cocaine trade in this town, do you think?
translation.ko: 그래서 이 마을에서 코카인 거래가 성행하는 걸까요?

translation.en: The kids, when they are like five,
uh... they are already in the streets.
And when you're in the streets, there are gangs around.
There is narco traffic around.
And by the age of ten,
they are already, like, being hired to be the bell-ringers
that tell the gangs, like, "They are here. They are there."
And the only thing they wish for is to do a cocaine run.
translation.ko: 그리고 걔들 소원은 코카인 판매상이 되는 거예요

translation.en: They earn like a hundred thousand pesos, so it's like a lot.
translation.ko: 10만 페소 정도 버는데 꽤 큰 돈이죠

translation.en: The promise of such riches
compared to not having running water in your house
translation.ko: 물도 안 나오는 집에서 사는 입장이라면

translation.en: -has gotta be pretty tempting. -Exactly.
I've been hanging with them, and I ask them, like,
"What is your dream? What do you want to be?"
And they say,
"No, we live in the present.
We don't care about ten years ago--
further, because there is the possibility
there's not going to be ten years further."
[Fox] One third of the population is unemployed.
Forty-five percent don't have potable water.
And 80 percent live beneath Colombia's poverty line.
translation.ko: 인구 80%가 콜롬비아의 빈곤선 아래에 살고 있습니다

translation.en: So, for so many here,
the only viable way to survive is by working in cocaine.
translation.ko: 코카인 관련 일을 하는 게 유일한 생존 방법이었죠

translation.en: It's like a cocaine factory town.
Two and a half hours outside of the city,
the factory extends to the jungles of the Andes Mountains,
where a cheap labor force kicks off the manufacturing.
translation.ko: 거기선 값싼 노동력을 이용해 약을 제조합니다

translation.en: About 82,000 Colombian families depend on coca farming for survival.
translation.ko: 콜롬비아의 약 82,000가구는 코카 농업에 생계를 의지합니다

translation.en: Unable to afford land of their own, they illegally farm
on over 400,000 acres of public land.
[Joel in Spanish] You plant a banana tree today,
and in a year, you are cutting a banana bunch.
And that banana bunch is going to be worth 5,000 pesos
translation.ko: 바나나 한 송이를 시장에 팔아 봐야

translation.en: in the market.
That's why we are forced to...
continue growing coca.
These crops generally grow...
um... every three months.
One of these sacks, uh...
a sack like that fits about five loads of leaves.
Ten thousand pesos per load.
So, then I have to, as a worker,
do about six loads daily so that you can
survive with your family.
[Fox in English] You need around one ton of coca leaves to produce a kilo of cocaine.
And for that ton, farmers are paid roughly $500,
a rate that hasn't changed in 30 years.
To break the business, you need to generate possibilities
translation.ko: 코카인 사업을 파괴하려면 합법적인 방법으로 수입을 올릴 "에르난도 술레타 경제학자, 안데스 대학교"

translation.en: uh... to generate income in a legal way.
translation.ko: "에르난도 술레타 경제학자, 안데스 대학교" 가능성을 제시해야 해요

translation.en: Otherwise, everything is going to be useless.
[Fox] In 2015,
the Colombian government started an ambitious crop substitution program,
translation.ko: 콜롬비아 정부는 코카 재배 농가가 불법 작물 대신

translation.en: hoping to convince coca farmers to replace their illegal crops
translation.ko: 합법적인 작물을 기르게 하려고 야심 찬 농작물 대체 프로그램을

translation.en: with legal ones.
But it's complicated
because they need not only productive products,
translation.ko: 생산성 좋은 작물만 있다고 다 되는 게 아니라

translation.en: but they need stable markets.
So with coca, they know someone is going to buy what they produce
on a regular basis
and they have relatively stable prices.
With other products,
this is not that clear.
So, to be able to be articulated into the legal market, they need roads.
translation.ko: 그래서 합법적인 시장에 진출하려면 길이 필요해요

translation.en: And this demands a huge amount of investment.
And I don't know if the Colombian government has the capacity
translation.ko: 솔직히 콜롬비아 정부가 그런 공공재를 공급할 능력이

translation.en: to supply these public goods.
So, the farmers are making logical economic decisions
translation.ko: 그래서 농부들은 자신들이 얻을 이익을 보고

translation.en: based on the incentives that are available to them?
Indeed, indeed.
[Fox] But the incentives are extremely limited,
not nearly enough to motivate coca farmers to switch to legal crops like coffee,
translation.ko: 농부들이 커피처럼 합법적인 농작물로 전환하기엔 부족해요

translation.en: which, unlike coca, has enormous overhead costs,
translation.ko: 커피는 코카인과 달리 경상비가 많이 들고

translation.en: wildly fluctuating prices,
and is increasingly susceptible to climate change.
translation.ko: 기후 변화의 영향을 많이 받기 때문입니다

translation.en: For a farmer with little money and limited resources,
translation.ko: 돈이 적고 자원이 한정적인 농부 입장에서는

translation.en: coca is a hard crop to beat.
This line of what's legal and what's illegal, for them,
is pretty irrelevant...
because when the government comes to them and says, like,
"Well, what you're doing is illegal,"
they can say, "Well, who the fuck are you? Like, I've never seen you here.
translation.ko: 그럼 이러겠죠, '당신 누군데? 이 동네서 처음 보는데'

translation.en: You've never cared about us for anything.
And so, your definition of legal means nothing to me."
translation.ko: '당신들이 생각하는 법적 정의는 내겐 아무 의미가 없어요'

translation.en: When you look at legal versus illegal farming,
translation.ko: 합법적 농업과 불법적 농업을 비교할 때

translation.en: I think we find it really comforting
to try to frame these as good versus evil, black versus white.
translation.ko: 혹은 흑과 백의 구도로 보면 마음은 편합니다

translation.en: We like to think that the people who perpetuate these crimes
are completely different from the rest of us
and that we would never make the same set of choices.
translation.ko: 그런 선택을 안 해도 된다고 생각합니다

translation.en: But in the end, based on my experience in the war on terrorism
and on this journey exploring the war on drugs,
translation.ko: 직접 겪은 제 경험에 비추어 보면

translation.en: these are rational human actors
who are making predictable economic decisions
based on the incentives that are available to them.
Decisions that we all might make if we were in the same situation.
translation.ko: 같은 상황이라면 우리도 같은 결정을 내릴 수 있어요

translation.en: [Fox] I've never flown in this one.
-[man] No? -No.
I've flown in Black Hawks, but never in these.
[man] But this is agile, versatile.
[Fox] Coca growing is only about nine percent of the cocaine business,
but it's a major focus of counter-narcotics efforts.
translation.ko: 마약 퇴치 작전의 가장 큰 부분을 차지합니다

translation.en: The government spends millions of US aid dollars on crop eradication.
translation.ko: 콜롬비아 정부는 팥을 파괴하는 데 미국 원조금 수백만 달러를 씁니다

translation.en: Part of the ten and a half billion dollars Washington's provided
has funded these helicopters and weapons,
intended to reach coca growth, far from the roads and infrastructure.
translation.ko: 도로와 기반 시설에서 떨어진 곳의 코카 재배를 통제합니다

translation.en: In the late '90s,
Colombia began using crop dusters
to spray weed killer on coca fields.
But in 2015,
aerial fumigation was halted over concerns that the chemicals
translation.ko: 화학 물질이 암을 일으킨다는 우려가 일자

translation.en: were causing cancer.
And now, they do it by hand.
[man in Spanish] The Colombian army, in their experience
translation.ko: 콜롬비아 육군은 마약 밀매와 불법 경작과 싸운 경험을 토대로

translation.en: fighting drug trafficking and illicit crops,
translation.ko: 마약 밀매와 불법 경작과 싸운 경험을 토대로

translation.en: have found that...
the militias hide explosive devices in the plants.
translation.ko: 식물에 폭발 장치를 숨긴단 걸 알아냈어요 "카를로스 콜롬비아 육군 마약 퇴치 부대"

translation.en: [Fox in English] These units are heavily armed
because of the many insurgent and right-wing paramilitary groups
translation.ko: 불법적인 우파 저항 무장 단체 다수가

translation.en: involved in the drug trade.
The nation's largest insurgent group,
the Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia, or FARC,
reached a peace deal with the government in November 2016.
But many FARC factions rejected the terms
translation.ko: 하지만 많은 FARC 분파는 반기를 들었고

translation.en: and continued to fund themselves, at least partially,
translation.ko: 여전히 코카인 밀매로 적어도 경비의 일부를

translation.en: by trafficking cocaine.
[Carlos in Spanish] A team first clears the area to guarantee that there are no explosive devices...
translation.ko: 한 팀이 먼저 들어가 폭발물이 없는지 확인하면

translation.en: so they can do the manual eradication.
[Carlos in Spanish] The team of eradicators manually dig with shovels
from the root
because when cutting with machetes,
it leaves the root and the plant to grow back again.
It's hard work, but we keep at it.
Normally, on a daily average, we eradicate from two to three hectares.
The new government's objective is... reducing
existing crops by up to 70 percent in four years.
[Fox in English] I've seen this kind of thing in the war on terror:
a ton of money spent with little effective result.
Only 1,000 feet away from the eradication site,
our farmers from earlier work their harvested leaves into a paste,
translation.ko: 아까 만났던 농부들이 수확한 잎을 으깨고 있는데

translation.en: the next step in cocaine production.
So, as a coca farmer in this area,
you grow coca and you do the processing yourself?
[in Spanish] Coca is grown in one place
and loaded in another place, where it is processed.
translation.ko: 다른 곳으로 옮겨 가공해요 "마르코스 코카 재배 농부"

translation.en: [Fox in English] And as a coca farmer, do you also own the lab?
translation.ko: 코카인 농부신데 직접 실험실도 갖고 계세요?

translation.en: [in Spanish] Ah, yes.
It is possible to get a little more than the normal price.
translation.ko: 그래야 가격을 더 잘 받을 수 있거든요

translation.en: [Fox in English] Most farmers sell their raw coca to makeshift labs
translation.ko: 대부분의 농부가 임시 실험실에 생 코카 잎을 팔면

translation.en: that then turn it into a paste before selling it to the cartels.
translation.ko: 거기서 코카 페이스트를 만들어 카르텔에 팝니다

translation.en: But these guys built their own lab,
translation.ko: 하지만 이 사람들은 직접 실험실을 만들어

translation.en: working their way along the supply chain to capture more of the profit.
translation.ko: 공급하면서 더 많은 이익을 올리고 있습니다

translation.en: [in Spanish] The gasoline washes the coca leaf.
[Fox in English] After the leaves are mulched, they are soaked in gasoline
translation.ko: 잎을 잘게 부순 후에 휘발유와 소량의 황산에 담가서

translation.en: and a small amount of sulfuric acid
to extract cocaine alkaloids from the coca leaves.
[in Spanish] There you can see the gasoline, and here, you can see the product in the water.
translation.ko: 여기 이게 휘발유고 물속에 가루가 보이죠

translation.en: [Fox in English] Once strained, this mixture will be
translation.ko: 일단 물을 따라내면 이게 최종 제품의 기본이 됩니다

translation.en: the foundation for the final product.
Is it the cartel that sets the price that they pay?
[in Spanish] Yes, mostly the cartels and criminal gangs.
translation.ko: 네, 대부분 카르텔과 범죄 조직이 정해요

translation.en: They are the ones who manage the prices.
[Fox in English] Even though these farmers are earning a little more
translation.ko: 이 농부들은 코카 페이스트를 직접 가공해

translation.en: by processing their own coca paste,
the cartels still maintain a choke hold on them.
translation.ko: 카르텔이 여전히 주도권을 쥐고 있는 건

translation.en: They do this by controlling the price that paste can earn.
translation.ko: 페이스트 가격을 통제하는 게 그들이기 때문입니다

translation.en: It's just basic economics.
The producers get a very, very small margin over their cost,
translation.ko: 생산자는 비용에 비해 이익이 아주 적은데

translation.en: because, again, they're very diversified
by design, by business design.
So, most people understand monopoly.
One big actor controls the selling of a product.
Usually, as a buyer,
you're either gonna have to accept a lower quality,
or you're gonna have to accept a higher price,
or usually both.
Very few people know about a complimentary effect called monopsony,
translation.ko: 특정 제품의 가격을 정하는 구매자가 하나뿐인

translation.en: when there's only one buyer who sets prices for a particular product.
translation.ko: 수요 독점력에 대해서는 아는 사람이 잘 없죠

translation.en: One very simple example to think about is Walmart.
If you are a seller of socks or of T-shirts,
and Walmart is the only buyer, you have no other options.
translation.ko: 유일한 구매자가 월마트라면 다른 선택의 여지가 없죠

translation.en: [Fox] What would happen if you refused to sell for that price?
translation.ko: 그 가격에 팔지 않으면 어떻게 될까요?

translation.en: [in Spanish] I would simply have to leave the area and stop farming.
Go somewhere else because I could get killed.
translation.ko: 죽을 수도 있으니까 다른 데로 가든지요

translation.en: Sometimes, I'm afraid.
But we have no other way out as farmers.
[Fox in English] The cartel will pay about $900 for a kilo of paste and then process it,
with more chemicals, like kerosene, sulfuric acid, and sodium carbonate,
translation.ko: 황산, 탄산나트륨 같은 화학 물질을 넣고 가공해

translation.en: to refine it into what we know as cocaine,
worth 100 times more than the cartel's initial investment.
Once it's turned into cocaine, it's ready to be shipped.
But first, it needs to be concealed.
[Fox] Narco traffickers come at this from all angles.
They have drones. They have submarines. They dig tunnels.
translation.ko: 드론도 쓰고 잠수함도 쓰고 터널도 파지만

translation.en: But they also deploy foot soldiers who hide product in everyday materials.
translation.ko: 평범한 물건에 숨겨서 사람이 직접 옮기기도 해요

translation.en: [Fox] We have this cocaine here on the table.
Walk me through how it came to be right here.
[Luis in Spanish] They make it,
and they give me my coordinates to where I have to go and receive it.
translation.ko: 어디서 받아서 어디에 전달할지 좌표를 알려주면

translation.en: And it is our turn to pack it in that particular way.
[in English] Do you always hide them in toys like this?
[in Spanish] Not everyone does it like this.
They fit it in shoes...
in briefcases, computers.
[in English] Don't they search the cats?
They won't feel the brick of cocaine?
[in Spanish] Some do notice, but that depends on how...
you fix the stuffed animal or how you insert the cocaine.
[in English] Then what?
[in Spanish] That's all the process that I do to it.
And I get to the coordinates that they gave me...
at the Buenaventura port.
[Fox in English] So in this supply chain, your job is...
is just to hide the cocaine?
[in Spanish] Well, at the moment, it's the only thing I am doing.
I am earning two million pesos.
[in English] If you were to work at one of the shops nearby,
or doing another kind of work, how long would it take you to earn that?
translation.ko: 다른 일을 한다면 얼마나 일해야 그만큼 벌죠?

translation.en: [in Spanish] Possibly, it could be in two months...
or two and a half months.
[in English] This work that you're doing, it's very dangerous.
[in Spanish] I am more scared of the people that run the business,
translation.ko: 이 사업 하는 사람들이 더 무서워요

translation.en: because the law locks you down, but...
anyone who makes a mistake on the street,
that one doesn't live.
[Fox in English] Two million Colombian pesos is about 650 US dollars.
You can understand why he and others are willing to take the risk.
translation.ko: 왜 사람들이 위험을 감수하는지 이해할 수 있어요

translation.en: It's not as though people are born with a kind of inherent desire
translation.ko: 태어날 때부터 북쪽에 있는 미국이라는 나라에

translation.en: to move cocaine north to the United States for no reason.
It's moved here because there is a demand here.
What that creates, again, is a very profitable market
for people who are willing to engage in the risks to serve that market.
translation.ko: 물건을 시장에 대려는 사람들에겐 짭짤한 시장이 생겨요

translation.en: And that profit margin creates a lot of room for innovation,
translation.ko: 이윤이 크기 때문에 혁신적인 아이디어를 많이 내죠

translation.en: precisely to diversify risk and precisely to make sure
that we can always supply this market effectively.
[Fox] In attempts to curb that effectiveness,
Colombian authorities have found they can't really rely on
their eradication missions alone,
so they also employ the tactic of interdiction.
If you can't stop it when it's growing, you try to stop it when it's going.
translation.ko: 재배할 때 막을 수 없다면 나가는 거라도 막아야겠죠

translation.en: What is the total number of containers that come through this port every day?
translation.ko: "오스카르 카스티요 대령 콜롬비아 육군 마약 단속 부대" 매일 이 항구를 통과하는 총 컨테이너 수가 몇 개죠?

translation.en: [in Spanish] In this port, between 300 and 500 containers enter daily.
He's verifying that there are no illegal drugs inside the coffee.
translation.ko: 커피 안에 불법 약물이 없는지 검사하고 있어요

translation.en: [in English] I mean, I'm looking at how many hundreds of coffee...
bags are behind you.
If there were cocaine hidden in one of those bags,
translation.ko: 저 수백 개의 자루 중 하나에

translation.en: out of all those hundreds, would you find it?
[in Spanish] When the containers enter, we have technologies like scanners.
We also have biosensors through dogs.
And finally, the physical inspection is also done.
[in English] What would happen if there were cocaine there? You'd see it?
translation.ko: 저 안에 코카인이 있으면 어떻게 되나요? 결국 찾아내나요?

translation.en: [man in Spanish] You'd see something white right there.
[Fox in English] It's hot. You could make a cup of coffee just with that heat.
translation.ko: 뜨거운데요 이 열기만으로도 커피 한 잔 만들겠어요

translation.en: -[laughs] -Yes.
[in Spanish] This year, 5,000 kilos of cocaine have been seized in this port.
[Fox in English] Five thousand kilos is about five tons of coke,
and that may sound like a lot of cocaine, but it pales in comparison
translation.ko: 굉장히 많다고 생각하겠지만 매년 단속을 피해

translation.en: to the 1,400 tons evading detection
and making its way out of the country every year.
[in Spanish] We need the divers to submerge
and make an inspection underneath.
When the tide rises...
it usually covers up a lot of the area.
We're gonna do a dock check.
[Herrera in English] Problem.
[Herrera in Spanish] Let's go and check that boat.
It was found in the rudder, right in the propeller.
translation.ko: 방향타 쪽에서 찾았어 프로펠러 안에 있었어

translation.en: [man] As we can see, it has some rubber in between the packaging,
which serves to waterproof the alkaloid.
As we can see, a powder.
A fine white powder.
A turquoise blue is a positive test for cocaine.
translation.ko: 청록색이 나오면 코카인 양성 반응인 거죠

translation.en: [man] Fifty-eight packages were found...
representing a weight of 56 kilos of cocaine.
translation.ko: 총 코카인 56kg이 들어 있었어요 "혼 오소리오 소령 콜롬비아 경찰 마약 단속반"

translation.en: This cocaine was headed for Japan.
[Fox in English] In the US, 56 kilos is worth about $1.5 million wholesale,
or 4.6 million on the street.
And in Japan, it can be worth more than double that.
translation.ko: 그런데 일본에서는 그보다 두 배는 더 비싸죠

translation.en: Globally, the price of cocaine varies hugely,
translation.ko: 전 세계적으로 다르게 책정된 코카인 가격은

translation.en: dictated by how hard it is to smuggle the product from Colombia
translation.ko: 콜롬비아에서 밀수해 오는 게 얼마나 어려운지에 따라

translation.en: to local markets.
For the port police, that's a sizable seizure,
but there are always other players
waiting to pick up a failed trafficker's slack.
[in Spanish] Here, I am finishing up packing.
From here, we go towards the dock.
[Fox in English] There are hundreds like Luis heading to the port,
all with packages to be taken to Mexico,
and then, ultimately, to the United States.
[Luis in Spanish] Ending up in jail is horrible.
I wouldn't wish it on my worst enemy.
[Fox in English] Luis recently did time for trafficking,
translation.ko: 루이스는 최근에 밀매로 감옥에 갔다 왔는데

translation.en: something that would make most people reevaluate their line of work.
But this is Buenaventura,
and he sees moving cocaine as his only option to stay alive.
translation.ko: 코카인 배달을 해야만 생존할 수 있다고 생각합니다

translation.en: [Luis in Spanish] Moving cocaine, for handling, going to pick it up in one place
translation.ko: 코카인 이동은 한 곳에서 코카인을 받아

translation.en: then dropping it off in another,
they pay nothing. A million pesos.
They'll give half at the pick-up,
and the rest when the stuff reaches its destination.
Everything you do, only to get back so little.
translation.ko: 힘들게 일해도 받는 게 너무 적어요

translation.en: We're the losers.
[Fox in English] The producers and even the early processors are not really...
translation.ko: 생산자와 초기 단계의 가공업자는 파블로 에스코바르처럼

translation.en: -living the Pablo Escobar lifestyle. -Oh, gosh. No.
The dealers, on the other end, aren't either,
so as it keeps doubling and doubling and doubling,
translation.ko: 그런데 가격은 계속 몇 배로 뛴다고 하고

translation.en: and we hear these billions of dollars changing hands,
who's making that money?
The Mexican cartel and the large criminal organizations
translation.ko: 멕시코 카르텔과 거대 범죄 조직 등이

translation.en: that are managing the central parts of the value chain.
There are parts of the value chain, where in order to...
be able to say that you can reliably deliver
large amounts of a product that is illegal,
translation.ko: 잘 배달할 수 있다는 믿음을 주기 위해서는

translation.en: that means that you have to control the territory
through which it's gonna be moving. And the only way when you do it,
translation.ko: 장악해야 한단 의미고 그렇게 할 유일한 방법은

translation.en: if it's a black market, is through violence.
[man] The Sinaloa Cartel,
one of the largest and most dangerous drug cartels in the world,
translation.ko: 세계에서 가장 크고 위험한 마약 카르텔 중 하나로

translation.en: responsible for smuggling hundreds of tons of cocaine
translation.ko: 수백 톤의 코카인을 미국으로 "리처드 도너휴, 검사 뉴욕 이스턴 지부"

translation.en: into the United States.
[Fox] After the fall of Escobar
and the closure of the Caribbean route to Miami,
the Mexican cartels took over all transport
translation.ko: 멕시코 카르텔이 미국과 그 외 나라로 가는

translation.en: to the United States and beyond.
It's estimated that cartels profit an average of $24 billion a year,
translation.ko: 이 카르텔의 매출은 미국에서 들어오는 것만도

translation.en: just from US sales alone.
And when it comes to cartels,
Sinaloa is the gold standard.
It controls as much as 60 percent of Mexico's drug trade,
with annual earnings reaching $3 billion.
The product moves north within Mexico,
translation.ko: 제품은 멕시코 내에서 북쪽으로 이동할 때는

translation.en: usually in small shipments,
stopping in safe houses along the way.
There are thousands of hidden garages like this, all over Mexico,
translation.ko: 멕시코 전역에 이런 숨겨진 차고가 수천 개가 있어서

translation.en: constituting a nearly indestructible path of coke into the States.
translation.ko: 미국으로 가는 코카인 경로를 차단하는 게 불가능할 정도죠

translation.en: [in Spanish] We have 300 kilos of cocaine here.
translation.ko: 여기 있는 코카인은 300kg이에요 "후안, 코카인 밀매업자 시날로아 카르텔"

translation.en: When it enters Sinaloa, it's safe.
translation.ko: "300kg 미국 도매가 약 810만 달러" 시날로아를 통하면 안전해요

translation.en: Everything is well taken care of with lookouts.
translation.ko: 경비를 세워 모든 걸 일사천리로 처리합니다

translation.en: Here, we are just a piece.
I pick it up in a boat and unload it.
And I treat it, put a condom on it…
It's like a special bag, a seal so it can be in water.
translation.ko: 물에 넣어도 안 젖는 특수한 봉지 같아요

translation.en: After a few days, when they tell me, I load it up.
translation.ko: 며칠 후 명령이 내려오면 배에 실어요

translation.en: At the moment, there are no enemy cartels here…
but in this life, you never know.
We need to go…
Hurry, hurry, hurry!
[man] Let's go.
[Juan] It's a lot of profit. That's why it works.
[in English] So, how does cocaine grow in value?
Based on the amount of risk that exists at each chunk,
translation.ko: 각 단계별로 존재하는 위험의 정도에 따라

translation.en: and you see the profits kind of reflect that.
translation.ko: 이익이 비례하는 걸 볼 수 있어요

translation.en: If you think about the chain,
it's kind of like an hourglass,
where it's very diversified at the top, where you're producing,
translation.ko: 물건을 생산하는 맨 위는 다양한 사람들이 관여하고

translation.en: but then from then on, it's very, very centralized.
It becomes concentrated where you have to transport things in bulk,
translation.ko: 물건을 대량으로 운반할 때 좀 더 집중적으로 되는데

translation.en: and you have to be able to protect that.
And when you shift to the transportation, where the risk is much higher,
that's where the first kind of very big jump in profitability happens.
translation.ko: 수익이 처음 큰 폭으로 뛰게 되죠

translation.en: [Juan in Spanish] In Colombia, it costs $2,500 a kilo...
And in Manzanillo,
it costs between $12,000 and $14,000.
Let's go! Let's go!
And here in Sinaloa, it's $17,000
and $26,000 in California.
They are going to meet a bigger boat.
From here, it goes all by sea up to...
San Felipe to Baja.
There, it is divided up and transported to the United States,
translation.ko: 거기서 물건을 적은 양으로 나눠 차에 실어

translation.en: little by little, by car.
-[man] Ready. -[Juan] Let's go! Go!
♪ Born in the north, in Ciudad Juárez ♪ ♪ Fighting through life He and his brothers ♪
translation.ko: 북부 시우다드 후아레스에서 태어난 형제들은 힘겹게 살았고

translation.en: ♪ Noon, night, or in the morning He worked all the time ♪
♪ Without stopping In the name of the business ♪
♪ And that's "El Moy" In his Buick, fully armed ♪
♪ Blowing up Raising dust wherever he goes ♪
♪ With all the merchandise For the civilians who like to party ♪
translation.ko: 파티를 좋아하는 사람들을 위한 온갖 물건이 있어

translation.en: ♪ So that they don't have to battle ♪
♪ And those who don't like my job ♪
♪ It's him who you are facing ♪
♪ And it's up to you, man! ♪
The power of Juarez.
Everyone wanted to take this place.
Because it was easy to go to the United States.
It's not like Arizona, where you have to go through the desert.
It's several days walking to get to your delivery point.
translation.ko: 배달 지점까지 가려면 걸어서 며칠이 걸리는데

translation.en: The crossing is easier in Juarez.
I started transporting up to 50 kilos to America.
It was transported from Colombia to Sinaloa.
At the time, there were still tunnels here in El Paso.
Underground places where we could pass it.
translation.ko: 지하로 통과할 수 있는 곳이 있었죠

translation.en: We went down the tunnel, down the river.
Just here, there was a tunnel that connected to a house in Chihuahuita.
translation.ko: 여기에 치우아우이타의 집과 연결되는 터널이 있었어요

translation.en: They'd load up everything there and take it away.
[Fox in English] These abandoned tunnels are relics.
translation.ko: 이 버려진 터널은 이제 유물이 됐고

translation.en: Today, cartels hide in plain sight,
often flowing right through the official ports of entry.
Usually concealed among legal goods being transported to the States,
translation.ko: 보통 미국으로 들어오는 합법적 물건에 숨겨 들어오는데

translation.en: whether the carrier knows it or not.
[Canales] And you observe that, as a criminal organization,
translation.ko: 이걸 관찰해 보면 범죄 조직 입장에서는

translation.en: it's glorious, right?
Because you have this kind of highway of trucks and trains and things
translation.ko: 미국으로 물자를 가져가고 가져오는 트럭과 기차가 있고

translation.en: that are moving stuff in and out of the US,
where it's very easy
to weave your product into that.
[man in Spanish] There are trucks loaded with cocaine,
but they don't cross kilos and kilos
in a single vehicle…
No, it's a continuous traffic in small quantities:
three kilos, five kilos, or ten kilos.
[Fox in English] Despite two decades of interdiction efforts by the US and Mexico,
Americans are still spending billions on cocaine.
translation.ko: 미국은 여전히 코카인에 수십억 달러를 씁니다

translation.en: For authorities here in Juarez,
it's a never-ending game of cat and mouse.
[in Spanish] No vehicle follows me unless I give the order.
translation.ko: 명령을 내리지 않으면 날 따라오는 차량은 없어요

translation.en: We arrested some people with guns
from the Sinaloa Cartel.
We got more information.
The cocaine stayed in another vehicle.
A white truck that came here.
Texas license plates.
[man on radio] They are already at the traffic light.
-They are probably a minute away. -Copy. Copy that, Unit Two.
Be ready. Be ready.
We're going to inspect your vehicle.
[man] Go ahead.
[officer] About... up to 26.
Thirty-six packages.
Put him in the patrol car.
[man in English] Every group has their preferred ways of smuggling...
translation.ko: 각 조직이 선호하는 밀수 방식이 있는데 "마이크 마약단속국 요원"

translation.en: and they're always looking for some new avenue
to find a way to help get a higher percentage of their product
translation.ko: 더 많이 들여올 수 있는 방법을

translation.en: into the country.
It's that access into the United States.
And from the United States, you have the Interstate Highway System.
translation.ko: 일단 미국에 들어오면 주간 고속도로를 이용합니다

translation.en: You can take it wherever you want from that point.
So, you get to the point where the cocaine arrives
in the United States,
and you describe this kind of opening of the hourglass
and many different paths to distribution
translation.ko: 미국 내 다양한 유통 경로를 통해

translation.en: within the US, that last mile to the party.
You have a number of people who are kind of very committed
to their habit of using cocaine.
They recognize that this is a black market,
and so therefore they recognize that it's a risky behavior,
translation.ko: 그래서 이게 위험한 일이란 걸 알고

translation.en: and that it requires risky behavior to serve that market.
translation.ko: 시장에 공급하는 일도 위험하다는 걸 알아요

translation.en: And so, they're very happy to pay large premiums
to have the product delivered to them.
[Fox] The murders, the kidnappings, this brutal violence
translation.ko: 멕시코 카르텔의 힘이 이렇게 강력한 한

translation.en: is gonna continue as long as the Mexican cartels
are as powerful as they are.
and they're going to be as powerful as they are
translation.ko: 수요가 있는 한 합법적인 회사 중에서

translation.en: so long as they're servicing a demand that no legal company can compete with.
translation.ko: 경쟁할 곳이 없기 때문에 더 강력해질 겁니다

translation.en: And that demand comes from us, from the United States.
translation.ko: 그 수요의 원천이 바로 우리 미국입니다

translation.en: Friday and Saturday nights, people are at parties, they're at clubs,
translation.ko: 금요일과 토요일 밤에 사람들이 클럽에서 파티할 때

translation.en: they're ordering coke on their cell phone, buying blow on the street corner.
And what they don't know,
or refuse to acknowledge,
is that, ultimately, they're funding a chain of human suffering
translation.ko: 그런 선택이 결국 사람들을 고통에 빠트리는 데

translation.en: with that choice.
This is a global, multibillion dollar business,
translation.ko: 이건 세계적으로 가난한 사람들의 고통 위에 세워진

translation.en: built on the backs of the poor.
In my experience in the field, over years of service,
I've realized you can't just keep doing the same thing
over and over again
when you keep seeing the data to show that it doesn't work.
We're ten and a half billion dollars into the war on drugs
in Colombia alone.
Half a million Colombians have died.
And last year, more cocaine shipped than ever before.
translation.ko: 작년에 운반된 코카인 양은 최고치를 찍었고요

translation.en: Legalization may seem pretty extreme to most Americans,
but as long as the demand continues to climb
and the prices remain astronomically high because of no legal competition,
translation.ko: 수요가 계속 증가하고 천문학적인 가격을 유지하면

translation.en: I can't help wonder whether legalization and regulation
is the only real option.
And prohibition is just an illusion to make us all feel good.
translation.ko: 금지는 우리 모두를 안심시키는 환상일 뿐이고요

translation.en: An illusion that's costing millions of dollars
and thousands and thousands of lives.
MURDERED
[Fox] So for Roy, back in LA...
it's business as usual.
Are you ever afraid that cocaine will...
lose its appeal, and you won't have any customers left?
translation.ko: 사람들이 안 찾을까 봐 걱정되지 않나요?

translation.en: Never.
Never say never, but it's always gonna be there.
translation.ko: 장담은 하지 말라지만 코카인은 안 사라져요

translation.en: So it's like, when you got money,
that's the drug of choice.
As long as somebody still want it,
as long as I can live it out and sell it out,
I'm gonna do it.
